titleStmt.title: An humble remonstrance of the representations of divers moderate, and peaceable citizens of London, to both Houses of Parliament: with twelve propositions, for the setling of a firme and lasting peace, and reconciling all differences in the Church of England: vvhich being granted will give much satisfaction to all pious, godly, moderate men, whether they be Presbyterians, Independents, prelaticall or royalists.

An humble remonstrance of the representations of divers moderate, and peaceable citizens of London, to both Houses of Parliament: with twelve propositions, for the setling of a firme and lasting peace, and reconciling all differences in the Church of England: vvhich being granted will give much satisfaction to all pious, godly, moderate men, whether they be Presbyterians, Independents, prelaticall or royalists.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
